alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 10:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southwestern Banner, southern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1046 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Hawk Springs, or 27 miles southwest of Torrington, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lingle, La Grange, Albin, Yoder, Huntley, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Veteran, Gun Barrel and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County
